name: Pulled Pork Tamale Casserole
author: James
summary: From time to time, I cook a pork shoulder and pull the pork to be used with a few different meals. This is a recipe I came up with that may not be a traditional tamale but the ingredients meet the criteria and it is a filling comfort food. There is no reason why you couldn't substitute shredded chicken or ground beef for the pork.
ingredients: 1 (4.5 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers
½ cup black beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Combine pulled pork, enchilada sauce, green chile peppers, black beans, corn, onion, and olives in a large bowl
Spread mixture into a 9x13-inch casserole dish
Combine corn bread mix, milk, egg, and butter in a separate bowl
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and casserole is hot, about 35 minutes
